questions.question: You are a student with a B2 proficiency in English. Your class teacher will ask you a question. You should answer this question with the minimum of 100 words. Should study abroad be a compulsory part of education? Explain your point of view.

answers.answer: Yes, I believe that study abroad should be a compulsory part of education. There are numerous benefits to studying abroad, such as improving language skills, broadening cultural understanding, and developing independence. By studying in a different country, students are exposed to diverse cultures, customs, and ways of thinking, which can help them develop a more open-minded and tolerant perspective. Furthermore, studying abroad can help students improve their language skills, as they are immersed in the language and culture of the country they are studying in. Additionally, studying abroad can help students develop independence, as they are responsible for navigating a new environment and adapting to new circumstances. Overall, I believe that the benefits of studying abroad make it a valuable and important part of education.
